channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15647] Backport HBASE-15507 to 0.98
item.description:
HBASE-15507 introduced an update_peer_config method to allow online changes to replication config. It depended on HBASE-11393, which so far exists only in master and can only be in 2.0 and above because of some incompatible changes to replication peer config serialization.
To get this in 0.98 will require two things:
1. Port the PeerConfigTracker in HBASE-11393 to 0.98 without taking the incompatible tableCF serialization changes.
2. Port HBASE-15507's logic on top of this.

Most of this work was done in HBASE-15633 for branch-1, but 0.98 is just different enough to need some tweaks of its own.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Backport of 15507/15633, with some minor tweaks for different constructors in 0.98, and to TestReplicationAdminWithClusters / TestReplicationBase to prevent the new test from causing existing tests to fail from side effects. Andrew Purtell, FYI.

-1 overall

These look like pertinent failures:

Failed junit tests hadoop.hbase.replication.TestReplicationChangingPeerRegionservers
hadoop.hbase.replication.TestReplicationDisableInactivePeer

Are you looking into them Geoffrey Jacoby ?
Reverted changes to TestReplicationBase that were breaking two other tests. These changes, which came from branch-1, turned out to be unnecessary.

Andrew Purtell - after my second patch, looks like the remaining -1's from HadoopQA are from JDK 8 Javadoc warnings and extant findbugs, both of which seem to be pre-existing. Is there anything else in this patch that needs attention before it's ready? Thanks!
No Geoffrey Jacoby, looks good. I will commit today.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Added update_peer_config to the HBase shell and ReplicationAdmin, and provided a callback for custom replication endpoints to be notified of changes to their configuration and peer data
